banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: "Rollercoaster"

recItems.blurb: It’s rare to come across a book that so beautifully encapsulates the complexities of women’s experiences of migration, colonization, Latinx culture, bisexual identity and love, but Daisy Hernandez’ powerful memoir does just that. This Cuban-Colombian-American daughter explores the many intersectionalities her life touches on and envelops us into her heartbreaking and heart-mending journey toward finding herself, her community and creating a new queer life.
recItems.headline: *A Cup of Water Under My Bed*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

recItems.blurb: What is it like for a 4-year-old girl to grow up in her grandmother’s home in Mexico while her divorced parents individually leave her and her siblings behind for a new life in the United States, otherwise referred to as "El Otro Lado" (The Other Side)? And what happens when her father comes to take them across the border, a few months before her 10th birthday, in a dangerous attempt to give them a new life with him? This gut-wrenching, harrowing and ultimately life-affirming memoir is powerful, important and a must read.
recItems.headline: *The Distance Between Us*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

recItems.blurb: Standing on the front line of the fight to educate America’s youth, Nadia Lopez takes us through her rollercoaster journey in starting Mott Hall Bridges Academy in Brownsville, Brooklyn, one of the poorest and most dangerous neighborhoods in all of New York City. Ms. Lopez is a smart no-nonsense force to be reckoned with, full of love and respect for the dignity of her students and teachers, and they love her for it. This book is informative, educational, grounded in reality, full of hope and offers solutions to very complex and difficult problems within the educational system.
recItems.headline: *The Bridge To Brilliance*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

recItems.blurb: You do not have to be a parent, a caretaker or have children to benefit from reading this book. Sometimes we must re-raise ourselves in order to become our truest selves. This insightful book reminds us that the "helicopter" parenting/caretaker trap can have detrimental effects on our children’s sense of self as they grow into adulthood. It’s possible that, in focusing so much on doing so much for their children, an entire generation of parents may have eclipsed their own kid's chances of developing a belief in their own selves, or a critical psychological trait called "self-efficacy." The alternative solutions offered in this book give hope for a future full of adults who have been allowed to develop the resilience, self-confidence and self-trust necessary for success.
recItems.headline: *How to Raise An Adult*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

recItems.blurb:
The "B" in the acronym LGBTQ (or LGBTQ+) stands for the bisexual* community; an often misrepresented and misunderstood group silenced by biphobia, bierasure and other fear based internalizations/projections within the LGBTQ community as well as outside of it. Large portions of the bisexual community are comprised of transgender people and people of color, and while the bisexual community is the single largest group within the LGBTQ community, it is one of the most at risk populations within it (according to a 2015 published study by BinetUSA, The Bisexual Organizing Project, and the Bisexual Resource Center in partnership with The Human Rights Campaign). Thanks to this groundbreaking book a generation of previously unseen bisexuals has been given a voice, and a new genre for books on bisexuality has been created. It was also named one of Lamda Book Report’s Top 100 Queer Books of the 20th Century. Education and knowledge is power. In the spirit of empowering ourselves, each other and our LGBTQ youth, I strongly encourage reading this book to understand the nuances and history of the bisexual community. 

*The term bisexual will be used as an inclusive term to mean romantic and/or sexual attraction to more than one gender, and includes pansexual, fluid, omnisexual and queer self-identifications.
recItems.headline: *Bi Any Other Name - Bisexual People Speak Out*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK
recItems.note:
Edited by Loraine Hutchins and Lani Ka'ahumanu
Riverdale Avenue Books, 2015

recItems.blurb: Founded by Cyndi Lauper, The True Colors Fund and TCF website is a great space to learn more about ways you can help end LGBTQ youth homelessness and create a world in which all young people can be their truest selves.
recItems.headline: The True Colors Fund
recItems.label: EXPLORE

recItems.blurb: Out of Exile is the first of what I hope to be a series of Virtual Reality Experiences to inspire empathy for what our LGTBQ youth sometimes go through when faced with the challenge of coming out to their families and loved ones. Forty percent of youth experiencing homelessness identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual or transgender, while LGBT youth represent an estimated 7 percent of the total youth population. Once they are out of their homes, LGBT youth are even more vulnerable. They are at a greater risk for victimization, unsafe sexual practices and mental health issues than non-LGBT young people experiencing homelessness. This project was built from the ground up by Nonny De La Pena and Emblematic Group, was chosen in January 2017 by Sundance Film Festival for it’s New Frontiers VR Program and was nominated for a Lumiere Award.
recItems.headline: Out of Exile
recItems.label: EXPLORE

nodes.whoTheyAre: Broadway and TV veteran Sara Ramirez challenges stereotypes even as she beguiles audiences.
nodes.whyListen:
Sara Ramirez has been known to viewers for the past 11 years as orthopedic surgeon Dr. Callie Torres on ABC's drama "Grey's Anatomy." Prior to that role, Ramirez was seen on Broadway in Monty Python's Spamalot as Lady of the Lake, for which she earned both a Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Musical and an Outer Critics Award for Outstanding Featured Actress in a Musical.

Ramirez graduated from the Juilliard Drama School. Shortly after graduation, she made her Broadway debut starring in Paul Simon's The Capeman. Following that, she starred on Broadway in Fascinating Rhythm and A Class Act, as well as Off-Broadway in The Vagina Monologues. For the past four seasons, Ramirez has been the voice of Queen Miranda in the Disney Channel animated series, "Sofia The First.," She has also appeared on "NYPD Blue," "Law & Order: SVU," "Third Watch" and "Spin City." In 2011, she captured a whole new audience when she performed the most prominent songs on the special music event episode of "Grey's Anatomy" and released her own EP on iTunes.

Most recently, Ramirez co-hosted and performed at TED Talks Live on PBS, and produced two films: Loserville (released in fall 2016 in partnership with the Pacer Foundation's Center for Bullying Prevention & Stomp Out Bullying) and the virtual reality film experience Out of Exile: Daniel’s Story, an Official Selection Sundance Film Festival and Lumiere Award nominee directed by Nonny de la Peña. Her next executive producing project is The Death and Life of Marsha P. Johnson, a documentary by filmmaker David France of How to Survive a Plague about LGBTQ civil rights transgender pioneers Sylvia Rivera and Marsha P. Johnson.

In 2015, Ramirez was awarded the Ally for Equality Award by the Human Rights Campaign Foundation. In addition to her role as a member of the True Colors Fund’s Board of Directors, she supports The True Colors Fund, Bisexual Organizing Project, NDLON, Mujerez De Maiz, The Task Force and The San Diego/New York/San Francisco LGBT Centers.

(Photo: Paul Gregory)

nodes.whoTheyAre: Michael Pemberton is a New York-based actor and singer/songwriter.
nodes.whyListen: Michael Pemberton has been a working actor and singer-songwriter in New York City for over 20 years. He has appeared in numerous films, television and stage productions from regional theater to Broadway. The Michael Pemberton Band has appeared in many of New York's most storied venues including The Bitter End, Birdland, Joe's Pub and, proudly with his friend and collaborator Sara Ramirez, at Town Hall for Ted Talks Live. He is the lucky husband of Andrea, and proud Dad to Katie, Jared and Megan.

videoData.description: Singer, songwriter and actress Sara Ramirez is a woman of many talents. Joined by Michael Pemberton on guitar, Ramirez sings of opportunity, wisdom and the highs and lows of life in this live performance of her song, "Rollercoaster."
videoData.socialDescription: Singer, songwriter and actress Sara Ramirez is a woman of many talents. Joined by Michael Pemberton on guitar, Ramirez sings of opportunity, wisdom and the highs and lows of life in this live performance of her song, "Rollercoaster."

cues.text: People tell you this one thing --
you give it everything you got
and you wind up on the street.
Then one day you wake up,
and they tell you "you're a queen,"
but then you find that someone else
But lose your edge or lose your cool,
they will drop you like a dime.
When your luck is running out,
and all these words are lies,
that the cautious one is wise.
